blog.name: comicsnoble
blog.title: Comics Noble
blog.description: Chelsea Noble reads too many comics and yells about them here. 29. Pan. She/her.

title: Pull List - February 13, 2019
body:
Finally back to posting my Wednesday pull lists. No indie books this week, to my own chagrin, but some quality Big Two titles. What’s everyone else picking up this week?

Captain Marvel #2

  • Writer: Kelly Thompson
  • Artist: Carmen Carnero
  • Cover Artists: Amanda Conner, Paul Mounts

I’m on record as a pretty big fan of Kelly Thompson in general, so I was excited to hear she was on the creative team for this new run of Captain Marvel. The first issue was pretty good, though it was almost excessively chatty and there was also A LOT going on. The art was pretty gorgeous so far, and I think I like her take on Carol’s personality, so I’m excited to see where this goes.

Detective Comics #998

  • Writer: Peter J. Tomasi
  • Artist: Jaime Mendoza, Doug Mahnke
  • Cover Artist: Jaime Mendoza, Doug Mahnke

Another “I jumped on because I really like the writer.” I had been playing catchup with Detective Comics, but when Tomasi took over, I decided now would be a good time to start picking up the monthlies even though I wasn’t fully caught up. The last issue was fun, if a little thin on actual story. I’m excited to see where we go with #1000 and onward.

The Flash #64

  • Writer: Joshua Williamson
  • Artist: Rafa Sandoval, Jordi Tarragona
  • Cover: Chris Burnham

Batman/Heroes in Crisis crossover. Oof, this is hitting me right in the feels. Last issue there was this flashback of Dick and Wally hanging out during their early sidekick days and that just about killed me. I think everyone who doesn’t like the Heroes in Crisis series/event is totally valid and they have great reasons for being upset. However, I am a sucker and I am eating up all this drama and grief with a spoon.

Mr. & Mrs. X #8

  • Writer: Kelly Thompson
  • Artist: Oscar Bazaldua
  • Cover Artist: Terry & Rachel Dodson

Look, they’re hot. Kelly Thompson is funny. Rogue has bee my favorite X-Man since I was like 10. Of course I’m still reading this.

Runaways #18

  • Writer: Rainbow Rowell
  • Artist/Cover Artist: Kris Anka

THE LAST KRIS ANKA ISSUE! *crying face* I am sad to see him leave, but I am excited to see what he does next. In the meantime, Rainbow Rowell’s writing is still terrific and I intend to keep reading indefinitely.

Shatterstar #5

  • Writer: Tim Seeley
  • Artist: Gerardo Sandoval, Carlos Villa
  • Cover Artist: Yasmine Putri

Look, all I want is a Shatterstar and Rictor reunion. That is all I am here for. Please and thank you.

Superman #8

  • Writer: Brian Michael Bendis
  • Artist: Brandon Peterson, Ivan Reis, Joe Prado
  • Cover artist: Ivan Reis, Joe Prado

I am still VERY WORRIED about Jonathan. However, I am liking how Bendis is handling the sudden age up. Lois and Clark are both responding how I think real parents would to hearing that they accidentally missed out on LITERALLY ALL OF JON’S ADOLESCENCE. They’re understandably distraught but also just so happy to have him back. That potent parental mix of anxiety, adoration, pride and grief reminds me of my own family… in a mostly good way.

Wonder Woman #64

  • Writer: G. Willow Wilson
  • Artist: Jesus Merino
  • Cover Artist: Terry & Rachel Dodson

The last issue was a blast. I love the new mythical creatures trying to live in modern America. Wilson’s Diana is expressive and relatable but still appropriately awe inspiring. After the first intro arch, we’re starting to get into a larger story with some grand, political and ethical themes. I’m excited to see where Wilson takes it from here.

summary:
Sparkle, Sparkle Ms. Marvel - Captain Marvel Edit
“My name is Carol Danvers. Ever since I was a little kid, I didn’t fit in....
body:
Sparkle, Sparkle Ms. Marvel - Captain Marvel Edit

“My name is Carol Danvers. Ever since I was a little kid, I didn’t fit in. See, I always wanted to fly.”

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

blog.name: marvelzombiespromos
blog.title: Marvel Zombies Promos
blog.description:
This is the promo page for Marvel Zombies RP. For more information, please visit our main page.

The characters advertised are not an exclusive list, rather they are a short list of suggestions. Our intention is to maintain a rotor of characters from a variety of backgrounds. Please feel free to apply outside of the characters posted here.

summary: The world has fallen to a monstrous infection, those who remain must band together to survive.  In Upstate New York, heroes and...
caption:
The world has fallen to a monstrous infection, those who remain must band together to survive.  In Upstate New York, heroes and civilians alike are working to build a life, even in the wake of civilisation crumbling.

Marvel Zombies RP open character: Carol Danvers

Moderator suggestion for this character:

Carol flew to Earth when the Alpha Flight Aerolith was initiating lockdown procedures, determined to assist the Avengers rather than hide in the safety of space.

Survivors connected to Carol:

  • Raven Darkholme • Mystique
  • Jessica Drew • Spider-Woman
  • Anna Marie LeBeau • Rogue
  • Natasha Romanoff • Black Widow
  • Tony Stark • Iron Man

Home || Plot || Rules || Taken/Open Characters || FAQ || Most Wanted

summary:
All Things 'Captain Marvel' with Brie Larson: Fight Sequences, Superpowers, Goose The Cat

  

'Captain Marvel' star Brie Larson...
caption:
All Things ‘Captain Marvel’ with Brie Larson: Fight Sequences, Superpowers, Goose The Cat

'Captain Marvel’ star Brie Larson joins The Hollywood Reporter for a round of 'Fishing for Answers.’ She talks about going outside her comfort zone with the action packed fight scenes, the difficulties of her costume, Goose the cat, and more!

blog.name: why-i-love-comics
blog.title: A blog dedicated to all your favorite moments
blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

blog.description: - Randa - 27 - TX - Cis she/her - My Paypal - Gaymer - Full-time fangirl - Writer/aspiring producer - Current obsessions: Critical Role, Killing Eve, & the MCU - Lifelong fan of superheroes, Star Wars, & fantasy - History buff, feminist, LGBT activist.

summary: I can't believe in the next couple of months we're getting new seasons of The Dragon Prince, She-Ra, Derry Girls, Killing Eve,...
body: I can’t believe in the next couple of months we’re getting new seasons of The Dragon Prince, She-Ra, Derry Girls, Killing Eve, Game of Thrones, AND two Marvel movies in theaters!! I don’t have asthma but I think I need an inhaler y'all…

reblog.comment: I can’t believe in the next couple of months we’re getting new seasons of The Dragon Prince, She-Ra, Derry Girls, Killing Eve, Game of Thrones, AND two Marvel movies in theaters!! I don’t have asthma but I think I need an inhaler y'all…
